fb9723d89f","dweb:/ipfs/QmPgSBD3V8su42tNGky7p1XpLV8SZkHs1ymjR8ZJcrbQqN"]},"project:/contracts/main/interfaces/ISystemDebtEngine.sol":{"keccak256":"0xdea42a6a4bdaa0d05cf187f1a1aa2b3b49ae5bccece43953b30342660037078e","license":"AGPL-3.0-or-later","urls":["bzz-raw://f1ca0e9a4a82970b6e681fb0db3fc39f456c673ccb0957ec079c42c907da80ca","dweb:/ipfs/QmXuPaGUT1xgCHJjDgty8w1pRSebeZ5vJondom5BW3T9FC"]},"project:/contracts/main/stablecoin-core/SystemDebtEngine.sol":{"keccak256":"0x750211fbf9897cca64c083863c67ceb2f4fac6659e3fcf93a420afeabbfae02c","license":"AGPL-3.0-or-later","urls":["bzz-raw://e935d2417567b19866e7012bac6b8aa53e6af7440a12cb7e6f259a06e86463f0","dweb:/ipfs/QmSz4VnpCokkPmZ4Z8XPd9rCUVeyfyX28kEzAezm2VeEmr"]},"project:/contracts/main/utils/CommonMath.sol":{"keccak256":"0x46538136f80d09dba3e60ba6f379e1a7032792cc92cf6ba7ca39ff9fc2a7923d","license":"MIT","urls":["bzz-raw://c1d9f764482a3ddb886bee974719008c86544e081cd50b7afabd94f6c4b0cc61","dweb:/ipfs/QmduYsKiFtTjeqKg36waKUrVRUcM6RysG8mqYhznJSrBXn"]}},"version":1}

deployedGeneratedSources.name: #utility.yul

documentation.text:
@title SystemDebtEngine
 @notice A contract that manages the bad debt and surplus of the system.
 The SystemDebtEngine acts as the debitor or debtor when a position is liquidated.
 The debt recorded in the name of SystemDebtEngine will be considered as system bad debt unless it is cleared by liquidation.
 The stability fee will be accrued and kept within the SystemDebtEngine, which acts as the holder of the surplus and uses it to settle bad debt.
 The contract is Pausable, meaning it can be paused by the owner or governance to temporarily prevent certain actions.
 It is also protected against reentrancy attacks using the ReentrancyGuard modifier.
 The contract has an active flag, live, which allows for system shutdown.

cage().details: This function is used to stop the operation of the contract for the emergency shutdown.      It can be called by the contract owner or a role designated as 'ShowStopper'.      If the contract is live (active), the function will deactivate the contract and stop its operations.       Before shutting down, the function attempts to settle any existing bad debt using available surplus.       After successful shutdown, the contract will no longer perform its functions until it is uncaged.

paused().details: Returns true if the contract is paused, and false otherwise.

setSurplusBuffer(uint256).details: This function is used to set the surplus buffer, which represents the minimum amount of surplus stablecoin      that should be maintained in the SystemDebtEngine.Reverts if the provided surplus buffer value is less than 10^45.      The surplus buffer should be set to a value large enough to cover potential bad debt settlements.      It acts as a safety measure to ensure the system remains solvent.

params._data: The new value for the surplus buffer.

settleSystemBadDebt(uint256).details: This function allows the system to settle its bad debt using the available surplus.       It requires that the caller passes an amount of stablecoin they want to use for settling the debt.      If the available surplus is sufficient, the specified amount of stablecoin is deducted from the surplus,       and the corresponding bad debt is settled.       If the surplus is not enough to cover the specified amount of debt, the function will revert.      It is essential to settle bad debt to maintain the stability and integrity of the system.

params._value: The amount of stablecoin to be used for settling the bad debt.

withdrawCollateralSurplus(bytes32,addres.details: This function allows the contract owner to withdraw a surplus amount of collateral from a specific collateral pool.      The surplus is the excess collateral that is not currently being used as collateral for any outstanding debt.Reverts if the caller is not the contract owner.

params._amount: The amount of surplus collateral to be withdrawn. [wad]
params._collateralPoolId: The identifier of the collateral pool from which the surplus collateral will be withdrawn.
params._to: The address to which the surplus collateral will be transferred.

withdrawStablecoinSurplus(address,uint25.details: This function allows the contract owner to withdraw a surplus amount of stablecoin from the SystemDebtEngine.      The surplus is the excess stablecoin that is not currently being used to settle bad debt.      Before withdrawing the surplus, the function checks that there is no remaining system bad debt.      Additionally, the function ensures that after the withdrawal, the remaining stablecoin balance in the SystemDebtEngine      is greater than or equal to the defined surplus buffer.Reverts if the caller is not the contract owner or if the system bad debt is still remaining.      Also reverts if the remaining stablecoin balance after withdrawal would be less than the surplus buffer.

params._to: The address to which the surplus stablecoin will be transferred.
params._value: The amount of surplus stablecoin to be withdrawn.

cage().notice: Enable the contract for the emergency shutdown

settleSystemBadDebt(uint256).notice: Settle system bad debt as SystemDebtEngine. This function could be called by anyone to settle the system bad debt when there is available surplus. The stablecoin held by SystemDebtEngine (which is the surplus) will be deducted to compensate the incurred bad debt.

withdrawCollateralSurplus(bytes32,addres.notice: Withdraw collateral surplus from a collateral pool

withdrawStablecoinSurplus(address,uint25.notice: Withdraw stablecoin surplus from the SystemDebtEngine

userdoc.notice: A contract that manages the bad debt and surplus of the system. The SystemDebtEngine acts as the debitor or debtor when a position is liquidated. The debt recorded in the name of SystemDebtEngine will be considered as system bad debt unless it is cleared by liquidation. The stability fee will be accrued and kept within the SystemDebtEngine, which acts as the holder of the surplus and uses it to settle bad debt. The contract is Pausable, meaning it can be paused by the owner or governance to temporarily prevent certain actions. It is also protected against reentrancy attacks using the ReentrancyGuard modifier. The contract has an active flag, live, which allows for system shutdown.
